intro: Ophiorrhiza schultzei, commonly known as the creeping mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, often found in tropical and subtropical regions. The plant has small, opposite leaves and produces small, white or yellowish flowers. Its fruits are usually small berries that contain seeds dispersed by birds. Ophiorrhiza schultzei is adapted to grow on other plants, drawing nutrients and water from its host through specialized roots.
